definition: profits pouring in from all sides (idiom)/raking in money/bonanza

sentences.english: The revenue is derived from the following sources.
May good fortune find you this year.
sentences.chinese: 祝你今年财运亨通，财源不断。

sentences.english: I have my coffer and my store at each of your houses.
sentences.chinese: 在你们每位的家中都有我的财源和贮存的物品。

sentences.english: High-quality goods and high-rank service enable them to gain profits from all sides.
sentences.chinese: 优质商品和优质服务，使他们财源滚滚。

sentences.english: The color gold is said to bring wealth, and the color red is considered especially lucky.
sentences.chinese: 金黄色象征着财源广进，红色被认为是特别吉利。

sentences.english: Or “sell your soul and the money follows.
sentences.chinese: 或者说，“出卖你的灵魂而财源滚滚”。

sentences.english: Wish you both health and wealth.
sentences.chinese: 祝你身体健康，财源广进。

sentences.english: The tricky question about his finances discomfited the minister.
sentences.chinese: 一个有关部长的财源方面的微妙问题使他感到很窘。

sentences.english: They are becoming the milch cow of the family.
sentences.chinese: 他们将成为家庭的财源。

sentences.english: Since the Tang Dynasty In China, the government used the loan system to collect revenue.
sentences.chinese: 中国自唐代起，官府大量用放贷法来筹措财源。

sentences.english: Fish hatcheries bring wealth but spoil the coast.
sentences.chinese: 养殖场虽然带来财源，却把海岸破坏了。

sentences.english: Plastic surgery is becoming a billion-pound industry in the UK.
sentences.chinese: 在英国，整容手术正成为财源滚滚的牟利行业。

sentences.english: Now the money is rolling in and he"s living on easy street."
sentences.chinese: 现在，他的财源滚滚，生活得可消遥自在啦。

sentences.english: Bhutan"s hydropower potential and its attraction for tourists are key resources.
sentences.chinese: 不丹的水力发电能力和其对游客的吸引是主要的财源。

sentences.english: I also wish the boss career, exchequer billow.
sentences.chinese: 我也祝愿老总事业顺利，财源滚滚。

sentences.english: The contract to supply computers to schools was a licence to print money.
sentences.chinese: 这个给学校提供电脑的合同真是像印钱一样财源滚滚。

definition: profits pouring in from all sides (idiom)/raking in money/bonanza
lit. there are principles behind making money (idiom); fig. to have a knack for good business/knowing how to accumulate wealth/good at feathering one's own nest
variant of 紅運|红运[hong2 yun4]
(of a political career) everything is going smoothly (idiom)
